title: Organization

http://schema.org/founder.description: A person who founded this organization. Supersedes founders.

http://schema.org/areaServed.description: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided. Supersedes serviceArea.

http://schema.org/member.description: A member of an Organization or a ProgramMembership. Organizations can be members of organizations; ProgramMembership is typically for individuals. Supersedes musicGroupMember, members. Inverse property: memberOf.

http://schema.org/review.description: A review of the item. Supersedes reviews.

http://schema.org/seeks.description: A pointer to products or services sought by the organization or person (demand).

http://schema.org/department.description: A relationship between an organization and a department of that organization, also described as an organization (allowing different urls, logos, opening hours). For example: a store with a pharmacy, or a bakery with a cafe.

http://schema.org/naics.description: The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for a particular organization or business person.

http://schema.org/vatID.description: The Value-added Tax ID of the organization or person.

http://schema.org/foundingLocation.description: The place where the Organization was founded.

http://schema.org/subOrganization.description: A relationship between two organizations where the first includes the second, e.g., as a subsidiary. See also: the more specific 'department' property. Inverse property: parentOrganization.

http://schema.org/contactPoint.description: A contact point for a person or organization. Supersedes contactPoints.

http://schema.org/owns.description: Products owned by the organization or person.

http://schema.org/hasPOS.description: Points-of-Sales operated by the organization or person.

http://schema.org/alumni.description: Alumni of an organization. Inverse property: alumniOf.

http://schema.org/duns.description: The Dun & Bradstreet DUNS number for identifying an organization or business person.

http://schema.org/dissolutionDate.description: The date that this organization was dissolved.

http://schema.org/brand.description: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

http://schema.org/location.description: The location of for example where the event is happening, an organization is located, or where an action takes place.

http://schema.org/hasOfferCatalog.description: Indicates an OfferCatalog listing for this Organization, Person, or Service.

http://schema.org/makesOffer.description: A pointer to products or services offered by the organization or person. Inverse property: offeredBy.

http://schema.org/parentOrganization.description: The larger organization that this organization is a branch of, if any. Supersedes branchOf. Inverse property: subOrganization.

http://schema.org/taxID.description: The Tax / Fiscal ID of the organization or person, e.g. the TIN in the US or the CIF/NIF in Spain.

http://schema.org/legalName.description: The official name of the organization, e.g. the registered company name.

http://schema.org/event.description: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action. Supersedes events.

http://schema.org/numberOfEmployees.description: The number of employees in an organization e.g. business.

http://schema.org/globalLocationNumber.description: The Global Location Number (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.

http://schema.org/award.description: An award won by or for this item. Supersedes awards.

http://schema.org/aggregateRating.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

http://schema.org/employee.description: Someone working for this organization. Supersedes employees.

http://schema.org/foundingDate.description: The date that this organization was founded.

http://schema.org/isicV4.description: The International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

http://schema.org/memberOf.description: An Organization (or ProgramMembership) to which this Person or Organization belongs. Inverse property: member.

http://schema.org/description.description: A short description of the item.

http://schema.org/sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.

http://schema.org/mainEntityOfPage.description: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See background notes for details. Inverse property: mainEntity.

http://schema.org/potentialAction.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

http://schema.org/additionalType.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

http://schema.org/image.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

description: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

http://schema.org/subOrganization.description: A relationship between two organizations where the first includes the second, e.g., as a subsidiary. See also: the more specific 'department' property. inverse property: parentOrganization.

http://schema.org/seller.description: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods. A seller may also be a provider. Supersedes vendor.

http://schema.org/broadcaster.description: The organization owning or operating the broadcast service.

http://schema.org/member.description: A member of an Organization or a ProgramMembership. Organizations can be members of organizations; ProgramMembership is typically for individuals. Supersedes musicGroupMember. inverse property: memberOf.

http://schema.org/customer.description: Party placing the order or paying the invoice.

http://schema.org/department.description: A relationship between an organization and a department of that organization, also described as an organization (allowing different urls, logos, opening hours). For example: a store with a pharmacy, or a bakery with a cafe.

http://schema.org/acquiredFrom.description: The organization or person from which the product was acquired.

http://schema.org/provider.description: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller. Supersedes carrier.

http://schema.org/sourceOrganization.description: The Organization on whose behalf the creator was working.

http://schema.org/composer.description: The person or organization who wrote the composition.

http://schema.org/recipient.description: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

http://schema.org/brand.description: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

http://schema.org/landlord.description: A sub property of participant. The owner of the real estate property.

http://schema.org/issuedBy.description: The organization issuing the ticket or permit.

http://schema.org/hostingOrganization.description: The organization (airline, travelers' club, etc.) the membership is made with.

http://schema.org/creator.description: The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork.

http://schema.org/memberOf.description: An Organization (or ProgramMembership) to which this Person or Organization belongs. inverse property: member.

http://schema.org/recordLabel.description: The label that issued the release.

http://schema.org/offeredBy.description: A pointer to the organization or person making the offer. inverse property: makesOffer.

http://schema.org/participant.description: Other co-agents that participated in the action indirectly. e.g. John wrote a book with *Steve*.

http://schema.org/producer.description: The person or organization who produced the work (e.g. music album, movie, tv/radio series etc.).

http://schema.org/followee.description: A sub property of object. The person or organization being followed.

http://schema.org/affiliation.description: An organization that this person is affiliated with. For example, a school/university, a club, or a team.

http://schema.org/productionCompany.description: The production company or studio responsible for the item e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

http://schema.org/serviceOperator.description: The operating organization, if different from the provider. This enables the representation of services that are provided by an organization, but operated by another organization like a subcontractor.

http://schema.org/translator.description: Organization or person who adapts a creative work to different languages, regional differences and technical requirements of a target market.

http://schema.org/underName.description: The person or organization the reservation or ticket is for.

http://schema.org/parentOrganization.description: The larger organization that this organization is a branch of, if any. Supersedes branchOf. inverse property: subOrganization.

http://schema.org/sender.description: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the sending end of the action.

http://schema.org/broadcastAffiliateOf.description: The media network(s) whose content is broadcast on this station.

http://schema.org/publisher.description: The publisher of the creative work.

http://schema.org/alumniOf.description: An organization that the person is an alumni of. inverse property: alumni.

http://schema.org/author.description: The author of this content. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

http://schema.org/creditedTo.description: The group the release is credited to if different than the byArtist. For example, Red and Blue is credited to "Stefani Germanotta Band", but by Lady Gaga.

http://schema.org/endorsee.description: A sub property of participant. The person/organization being supported.

http://schema.org/contributor.description: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork.

http://schema.org/agent.description: The direct performer or driver of the action (animate or inanimate). e.g. *John* wrote a book.

http://schema.org/endorsers.description: People or organizations that endorse the plan.

http://schema.org/copyrightHolder.description: The party holding the legal copyright to the CreativeWork.

http://schema.org/recognizingAuthority.description: If applicable, the organization that officially recognizes this entity as part of its endorsed system of medicine.

http://schema.org/reviewedBy.description: People or organizations that have reviewed the content on this web page for accuracy and/or completeness.

http://schema.org/attendee.description: A person or organization attending the event. Supersedes attendees.

http://schema.org/broker.description: An entity that arranges for an exchange between a buyer and a seller. In most cases a broker never acquires or releases ownership of a product or service involved in an exchange. If it is not clear whether an entity is a broker, seller, or buyer, the latter two terms are preferred. Supersedes bookingAgent.

http://schema.org/worksFor.description: Organizations that the person works for.

http://schema.org/performer.description: A performer at the event—for example, a presenter, musician, musical group or actor. Supersedes performers.
